pullRequest.body:
This fully rewrites `Combinatorics.Colex` to use a type synonym approach instead of abusing defeq.

We also provide some API about initial segments of colex.


---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

nodes.body: Switching this to WIP for the moment, Yaël and I have agreed on a different definition of this ordering, so I'll take it off queue while that gets organised.

Note: I have pushed an update to the lean toolchain because this PR was on a [buggy version](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/Potential.20data.20loss.20from.20.60lake.20clean.60.20with.204.2E2.2E0-rc2.2F3/near/397875701) of the toolchain. **WARNING**: checking out old commits of this PR using v4.2.0-rc2 or v4.2.0-rc3 can cause `lake clean` to delete your mathlib folder! If you need to do so, make sure to delete `lakefile.olean` manually before running any `lake` commands.
I don't think there's a good way to save the diff here. It is almost a rewrite from scratch.

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6984668156/job/19007824960)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6984668156/job/19007824881)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6984668156/job/19007824796)
bors d+
Can anything be done about the diff? Or should this be reviewed as a total rewrite from scratch?
bors d+

```suggestion
fixed size. For example, for size 3, the colex order on ℕ starts
```

```suggestion
* `Finset.toColex_image_lt_toColex_image`: Strictly monotone functions preserve colex.
```
I'd be pretty tempted to make this a one-field structure
I'll actually do it here because I can then extend the structure to `ColexWith` for the colexigraphic order on finsets of fixed size.
I think at this point it's entirely reasonable to add your name to this list

```suggestion
Authors: Bhavik Mehta, Alena Gusakov, Yaël Dillies
```

This might be my fault, but I don't think we have the lemma giving this equivalence. Could you add a TODO for it? If I'm wrong and we do have it, then we might as well link to it. It might also be nice to say that we avoid that definition so that Colex works on LT rather than LinearOrder

Actually, that's a good point. We don't care about non-linear orders (remember? you convinced me the current definition didn't make sense in partial orders), so we might as well use the simpler definition.
Can this be used to golf `finPiFinEquiv` or similar?
Ah nevermind, I see this is just a move. If you PR this move separately I'll merge it immediately.
I think I will need to generalise the lemma a bit. So I'll keep that for later.
I've generalised the lemma and I now think it can't be used for `finPiFinEquiv`, at least not without being generalised further.

Assuming this is a summation and not a sigma type:
```suggestion
on $∑_{i ∈ s} 2^i$. It's defined here on `Finset α` for any linear order `α`.
```
Surely it starts `012`?
Not in Cambridge! But yeah let's fix it.
nit: could put this in line above.

nit:
```suggestion
instance instLE : LE (Colex α) where
  le s t := ∀ ⦃a⦄, a ∈ ofColex s → a ∉ ofColex t → ∃ b, b ∈ ofColex t ∧ b ∉ ofColex s ∧ a ≤ b
```

nit: I think this should come immediately after the `LE` instance, and come with a docstring summarizing the definition.

edit: maybe the docstring is best on `toColex_le_toColex`
I won't put it there because `<` is not yet defined.
For `exact?` etc, I think it would be best to first state this using subset notation.
Does `exact?` care about the declaration order?
No; did I miss that you already have the subset version below?

I was trying to interpret your "first state". I definitely don't want to state your lemmas first because I'm using `Monotone.strictMono_of_injective`. In fact, I don't want to state them at all because I'm pretty sure `exact?` is smart enough and also because they are hard to name, but here they are.
~~Surely `hus` and `hut` aren't needed?~~ nevermind

```suggestion
/-- The colexigraphic order is insensitive to removing elements, providing those elements appear in both sets. -/
```
or similar

I think it might be worth keeping this public, for instance to derive injectivity or if composition of this with other things is useful. In fact I think it would be great to make this a order isomorphism, but that doesn't need to be in this PR.

```suggestion
/-- Being a nonempty initial segment of colex is equivalent to being an `initSeg`. -/
```
The equivalent condition here should mention the fixed size requirement I think, especially because "colex" in this file means on Finset Nat rather than fixing the size.
Does this suggest we should make `StrictMono (fun s => s.image f)` (with some toColex scattered as appropriate) taking `StrictMono f` as an argument
I've added the lemma but I'm not sure it's useful.

```suggestion
    s ≤ t ↔ ∀ h : s ≠ t, (ofColex s ∆ ofColex t).max' (by simpa) ∈ ofColex t :=
```
I guess? Or `by simpa using h`. And below
I've explicitly not done this because the proof term will show up in the goal, and I want to make sure it's small.
I really want `wlog` or some variant to be able to generate this...
Actually I think it Just Works?
Nevermind, we would need something like `wlog_suffices` or something.
Have you considered making this public? It's weirdly useful in this file so I somehow wonder if it has other applications
How would you name it?
I'm not so convinced about its current form. I've left a TODO instead of making it public.

```suggestion
-- TODO: Package the above in the `n=2` case as an order isomorphism `Colex ℕ ≃o ℕ`
```
(since it won't be surjective if `n > 2`)

```suggestion
`n`-ary expansion.
```
and similar below?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: New `Colex` API
